position.marginalia_text: [magis]terij. Item fit de manifesto occultum, secundu[m] Rodianu[m] in libro triu[m] verboru[m]. Item notetis quod in vno q[uo]q[ue] corpore sunt tres dimensiones, s[cilicet] Altitudo, Latitudo et profunditas, Ph[ilosopho] teste primo Coeli. Altitudo est id quod manifeste apparet de corpore, et primo subiacet visui n[ost]ro. Exempli gratia, Lapis n[oste]r in p[ri]ma sui creatione est albus: et ita apparet p[ri]ma facie: quia dicim[us] ip[su]m frigidu[m] et humidium (vt est) Rodiano sic asserente. Lapis n[oste]r est Aquaticus, quia est frigidus et humidus: et Aqua est frigida et humida: et humida aqua currit. Ideo iuro per memetipsu[m], quod veru[m] est: et talis dispositio d[ice]r[e] corporis Altitudo. Latitudo vero est illius medicina[e] dispositio per qua[m] itur ad profundu[m], qua[e] n[ost]ra medicina est: et est vita altitudinis ac profunditatis, tanq[uam] mediu[m] inter duo extrema, seu contraria, per quod in extremu[m] pervenitur: qua impossibilis est transitus de extremo ad extremum, sine medio. Sa[e]pe eni[m] dictum est quod Lapis n[oste]r est humida[e] et frigida[e] co[m]plexionis: Na[m] si volumus eum facere transire ad medicina[m] disponentem, necesse est vt altera qualitas distruatur in eo. marginalia.translation:
Similarly according to Rodianus in the Book of the Three Words. Also note that in any one body there are three dimensions, that is, height, width and depth, . Height is what is noticeably apparent of the body and what is first exposed to our sight. For example, a our stone in its first creation white and appears so from the surface, because we say that it is cold and humid (like it is) as asserted by Rodianus. Our stone is aquatic, because it is cold and humid, and water is cold and humid, and water flows.
Width is the disposition of its meidicine and it is the life of the height and the depth, just as the middle between the two extremes or the contraries, through which one reaches to the extreme. It is impossible to transition from one extreme to the other without the middle. For often it is said that our stone is of humid and cold constitution.
